plugins.name: Rename and Label
plugins.description:
This plug-in will provide 4 functions:

+Rename all frames in all pages with the following rules:

  • Prefix of the new name is the page's name
  • Horizontally aligned frames will have the suffix: A01, A02, A03 ...
  • Next group of Horizontally aligned frames will have the suffix: B01, A02, A03 ... and so on.

+Label all frames in all pages using the frame's name

+ Rename and then label the frame

+ Remove all the labels from the frames.


Note: if the top object of your frame is masked, the label will not show up.
plugins.tagline: Batch rename and label frames in all pages

plugins.name: DeckBot
plugins.description:
DeckBot is a simple plugin that will take a set of selected frames, and automatically set a click interaction to advance from one frame to the next in presentation mode. Instead of manually dragging links from one frame to the next one at a time, all you have to do is select the frames you want to include in your presentation, and DeckBot will do the rest!


Instructions

  • Select two or more frames on the page
  • Run DeckBot
  • Optionally adjust the order of your selected frames in the DeckBot popup
  • Click â€œcreate deckâ€
  • Launch presentation mode to see your new deck!


Additional Features

  • DeckBot is undoable
  • Any existing interactions set on elements inside your selected frames will be preserved


How to reach out and support

Having issues? DM me on Twitter @mklickman1


---


DISCLAIMER: This plugin is presented as-is, so use at your own risk!


While I do my best to test as many edge cases as possible, I am certain there are scenarios I havenâ€™t accounted for yet, but I welcome your feedback and suggestions. This began as a personal project I put together in my free time, and I will support as my time allows, but I cannot guarantee I will be able to address all concerns in a timely manner, so please take that into consideration as you use the plugin and provide feedback.
plugins.tagline: Create click interactions between frames with one click

plugins.name: Vitality AI
plugins.description:
Introducing Vitality AI â€“ a Figma plugin revolutionizing design creation! Generate stunning designs effortlessly with just a prompt description. From accordions to sliders, Vitality AI crafts various components to meet your design needs.


Using Vitality AI is a breeze. Simply run the plugin, wait for it to load, then describe your design and click generate. Avoid clicking elsewhere to prevent interference during the design process. Once generated, import your design into Figma with the click of a button. Need inspiration? Hit the randomize button for fresh prompts. Plus, customize import locations using the x and y coordinates.


Note: To use the plugin, users need to create a free Vitality AI account here.


Encounter an error? No worries! The plugin will notify you, or simply restart for a seamless experience. With Vitality AI, design innovation is at your fingertips.

plugins.name: Quick Frames
plugins.description:
Quick Frames has a vast library of device frame sizes. Figma defaults are very limited and Figma does not allow users to create and save their own set of device screen resolutions. I just put down a collection so you don't have to google them every time.


Why Quick Frames?

Figma currently lacks built-in support for a comprehensive device frame library.


Why did I build this?

Because I was bored and wanted to build something. I remember sharing a feedback on figma community forum few years ago and its still pending. So decided to make one for it.


Note: This plugin will become useless if Figma decides to support this feature. Till then, enjoy using it.


Reach out to me on Linkedin if you with to connect with me to work on a plugin / share feedback / simply to network ðŸ˜Š

plugins.name: BrandCentral Inspect
plugins.description: The BrandCentral Plugin is our in-house solution designed to seamlessly bridge the gap between our design and development teams, streamlining the conversion of Figma design components into ready-to-use CSS/SCSS code. By offering a unique method that translates text styles and visual properties directly into SCSS mixins and CSS classes following the BEM methodology, our plugin aims to revolutionize how development projects integrate design. Features include automatic conversion of component names to kebab-case, smart typography style mapping, and support for component variants and states, all automated to speed up the development workflow and ensure design consistency across all project aspects. Enhance efficiency, minimize redo's, and keep our teams in sync with the BrandCentral Plugin.
plugins.tagline: From Figma to Development

plugins.name: Find decimal point
plugins.description:
The Decimal Point Detector is a useful tool for designers working with Figma. It automates the process of locating and highlighting components on your Figma pages that have decimal points in their x, y, width, or height properties. These components are typically difficult to align perfectly on a pixel grid and might cause issues with your design layout.

Upon running the plugin, it traverses through each element on your Figma project pages. If it finds any components with decimal points, it places a customizable warning box over them with the text "DO NOT USE DECIMAL POINT". This clear visual indicator can help you quickly identify and fix any elements causing potential issues.

The warning box and text colors are customizable through a simple user interface. Users can choose their preferred color for the box and the warning text. By default, the warning box color is yellow (#FFCC00) and the warning text color is red (#FF0000). These colors can be adjusted using the color input fields in the UI, allowing for a personalized user experience.

If no components with decimal points are found in your project, the plugin will send a notification stating "Perfect components!", offering you reassurance about your design consistency.

The Decimal Point Detector plugin is an invaluable tool for maintaining precision and avoiding potential alignment issues in your Figma designs. It streamlines the design process by automating an essential aspect of design consistency, allowing you to focus on your creative process.
plugins.tagline: Find decimal point on artboard

plugins.name: Figma to Junction
plugins.description:
Globalize Your Designs

Globalize your work through seamless organization. Transfer written content of your designs from Figma into Junction and easily access all translated versions of the text from one location. 


Visual Context

Preview your design for visual context of translations


Get Started:

1. Launch the Plug-in

Click on the plug-in and log in with the demo account. Follow the plug-in instructions to choose a project and transfer your design to Junction.


2. Preview Your Work in Junction

Log in to Junction using the demo account below. You can view your design work in the â€œScreensâ€ section under the Figma Demo project.

plugins.name: Marq
plugins.description:
Introducing Marq - Your Tagging Companion for Figma


Marq is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your design workflow and boost productivity. With Marq, you can easily add tags, emojis, and colors to your Figma elements, making organization and collaboration a breeze.


Key Features:

  1. Tagging Made Simple: Marq lets you tag your Figma objects effortlessly. Whether it's marking elements with emojis, text, or both, Marq's intuitive interface makes tagging a breeze.
  2. Rich Emojis Library: Choose from a wide range of emojis to add personality and clarity to your designs.
  3. Color Your Tags: Customize your tags with vibrant colors. Highlight important elements or categorize your designs with a rainbow of options.
  4. Save Presets: Marq allows you to save your favorite tag combinations as presets. No need to recreate the same tags repeatedly; simply apply your saved presets in a click.
  5. Flexible Application: Apply tags and presets to selected objects or the page name, ensuring consistency across your Figma projects.
  6. Real-time Updates: Stay informed with real-time notifications as you tag and apply presets. Marq keeps you in the loop at every step.


Why Marq?

  1. Effortless Organization: Keep your designs tidy and well-structured with clear, visual tags.
  2. Improved Collaboration: Communicate design ideas more effectively with emojis and colors.
  3. Time-Saving Presets: Save time by reusing your favorite tag combinations.
  4. Enhanced Productivity: Streamline your workflow and focus on what matters mostâ€”designing.


Say goodbye to cluttered Figma files and hello to a more organized, efficient design process. Try Marq today and elevate your Figma experience!

plugins.name: Rename Variables, Collections & Styles
plugins.description:
Easily edit variable and collection names without clicking multiple buttons in variable editor


Editing variables in the variables popup dialog is complex, because

  1. You need to double click each name to start editing the name
  2. If you type a variable name that already exists, and press return, you get a error and loose whatever you typed


Renaming any collection needs 3 steps

  1. select collection from dropdown
  2. click open the dot menu
  3. click rename.

This becomes frustrating when you have to rename multiple collections.
plugins.tagline: Easily edit variable and collection names without clicking multiple buttons in variable editor

plugins.name: Material3 theme generator
plugins.description:
Dynamic Theme Generator for MD3


This feature allows you to create a dynamic theme for Material Design 3 based on your desired color. Using the library provided by MD3, it generates theme data automatically.


How to use:


Click on any Figma node with your desired color to create the theme.

If you prefer, you can input the specific color directly into Figma for precise usage.

With this tool, you can quickly implement dynamic themes in your designs while staying aligned with Material Design 3 principles.


If you have questions or issues.

mail me.


dnay2k@gmail.com

plugins.name: Figma Layout Fractions
plugins.description:
ðŸ“ Figma Layout Fractions


Bring CSS-style fractional layouts into Figma â€” now with full support for px, %, and decimal fr units.


Design responsive layout systems using familiar syntax like:


100px 50% 1fr 2fr

ðŸ”§ What it does

Apply flexible widths to any selection inside a Frame or Group

Mix px, %, and fr units in any combination

Support for decimal fractions like 0.5fr, 3.25fr, etc.

Automatically rounds widths for clean pixel-perfect layouts

Works across single or multi-row selections



ðŸ§ª Real-World Example

Container: 600px

Padding: 10px each side

Gap: 10px between items

Layout: 100px 50% 1fr 2fr


ðŸ§® Output:


100px (fixed)

300px (50% of full width)

Remaining space split between 1fr and 2fr

53px (1/3 of leftover)

107px (2/3 of leftover)


Perfect for layout prototyping, grids, or creating design systems with math that matches the web.
plugins.tagline: Easily create responsive layouts with CSS-like fractional units in Figma.

126012.release_notes:
Figma Layout Fractions v1.2 â€” Now with Decimal fr Support!

A small but mighty update to make your fractional layouts even more precise ðŸ’¥

ðŸš€ What's New
âœ… Decimal fr Units
Use values like 1.5fr, 0.25fr, or 3.75fr to get tighter control over flexible space distribution.

âœ… Mixed Units
Combine px, %, and fr all in the same layout string.
Example: 100px 50% 1fr 2fr â€” just like CSS grid.

âœ… Pixel-Perfect Rounding
All widths are now rounded to full pixels to avoid subpixel glitches in Figma rendering.

âœ… Smarter Percentage Handling
Percentage widths are calculated using the full container width (not leftover space), bringing results in line with how the web and tools like Framer behave.

ðŸ§ª Real-World Example
Container: 600px
Padding: 10px each side
Gap: 10px between items
Layout: 100px 50% 1fr 2fr

ðŸ§® Output:

100px (fixed)
300px (50% of full width)
53px (1/3 of leftover)
107px (2/3 of leftover)
This update brings results closer to what you'd expect from modern responsive layout tools.
126012.tagline: Easily create responsive layouts with CSS-like fractional units in Figma.

plugins.name: Square Wrap
plugins.description:
How to Use

  1. Arrange the images on Figma.
  2. Select all the arranged images.
  3. Run the plugin and press the button.
  4. All selected images will be wrapped in square frames.

plugins.name: Batch Variable Customizer
plugins.description:
Batch update variables with ease â€” across local and external libraries!


Effortlessly update multiple variables, including colors, aliases, or names, without the hassle of editing each one individually. This plugin streamlines variable management, allowing you to update color values, manage aliases, and rename entries seamlesslyâ€”whether you're working with local collections or external libraries. Handle updates, deletions, and renaming in just a few clicks, regardless of the scale or complexity of your variables.


Features:

  1. Batch update color variables for both local and external libraries.
  2. Effortlessly rename multiple variables to maintain consistent naming conventions.
  3. Bulk delete variables for quick and efficient cleanup.


Braces notation for aliasing:

  1. For local libraries: {collectionName.variableName}
  2. For external libraries: {LibraryName/collectionName.variableName}

Use the / suggestion box to quickly browse and select variables from your libraries, ensuring precise and consistent aliasing.


Huge thanks to Jan Six for creating the Batch Styler plugin, which inspired this tool; currently supporting color variables, with plans to expand to other variable types in the future!


Limitations:

Due to Figma API constraints, updates to external libraries (such as changes to variable names, new collections, or modes) will not be automatically reflected in the plugin. To capture such updates, simply reload the Figma file, and the plugin will synchronize with the latest changes.


Questions & Support

This plugin is still a baby panda, so if you notice any bugs or have any questions, please get in touch directly. I'll help you troubleshoot and resolve any issues as quickly as possible.
plugins.tagline: Batch update, rename, and delete variables effortlessly, including colors and aliases.

  3. Bulk delete variables for quick and efficient cleanup.


Braces notation for aliasing:

  1. For local libraries: {collectionName.variableName}
  2. For external libraries: {LibraryName/collectionName.variableName}

Use the / suggestion box to quickly browse and select variables from your libraries, ensuring precise and consistent aliasing.


Huge thanks to Jan Six for creating the Batch Styler plugin, which inspired this tool; currently supporting color variables, with plans to expand to other variable types in the future!


Limitations:

Due to Figma API constraints, updates to external libraries (such as changes to variable names, new collections, or modes) will not be automatically reflected in the plugin. To capture such updates, simply reload the Figma file, and the plugin will synchronize with the latest changes.


Questions & Support

This plugin is still a baby panda, so if you notice any bugs or have any questions, please get in touch directly. I'll help you troubleshoot and resolve any issues as quickly as possible.

networkAccess.reasoning: The plugin needs to access Mixpanel's APIs for user analytics, including tracking plugin usage and performance metrics. This helps in understanding and improving the plugin experience.

117202.tagline: Batch update, rename, and delete variables effortlessly, including colors and aliases.

plugins.name: Dola Project Starter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you, in one click, set up a new project with a good practice pages structure, variables and styles!


Generated styles and variables are based on Tailwind standards which is eliminating the gap between design and development styling primitives and improving the workflow out of the box.


This starter sets up:

  • color variables (primary shades, grays, destructive, border, etc.)
  • spacings variables
  • border radius variables
  • drop shadow effects
  • text styles (like text-2xl/font-bold, etc.)
  • grid styles (base, md, lg, xl, 2xl)
  • pages structure
  • file cover page


And many might be planned, such as:

  • generated style guide based on styles
  • components (buttons, toggles, image ratios, etc)
  • tailwind config export for developers
  • and maybe something else..


So stay tuned, and leave you feedback about what should we improve or add next.


With love,

Dola Service Team â¤ï¸
plugins.tagline: One-click project starter with Tailwind text, shadow, grid styles and pages structure
